plugin.name: RawConfigTest
plugin.description: A plugin for testing raw configuration

server.name: Structured and Raw Server
server.description: A fake server component that supports both structured and raw configuration

c:simple-property.name: filesToFailValidation
c:simple-property.description: A whitespace-separated list of file names for which validation will fail. The entire path does not need to be specified. Simple matching will be done starting from the end of the path. For a path of /foo/bar.txt, you could specify bar.txt.

c:simple-property.name: filesToFailUpdate
c:simple-property.description: A whitespace-separated list of file names for which the update will fail. The entire path does not need to be specified. Simple matching will be done starting from the end of the path. For a path of /foo/bar.txt, you could specify bar.txt.

c:simple-property.name: structuredUpdateDelay
c:simple-property.description: A delay specified in milliseconds to simulate a long running operation. This delay will affect the structured update method, persistStructuredConfiguration.

c:simple-property.name: rawUpdateDelay
c:simple-property.description: A delay specified in milliseconds to simulate a long running operation. This delay will affect the raw update method, persistRawConfiguration. Note that persistRawConfiguration is called once for each raw config file; so, if you specify a delay of 5000 (i.e., 5 seconds) and there are 5 raw config files, then this will result in a delay of 25 seconds.
